frameDefinitions: A Figure is located relative to a Ground location.
A New_member becomes a member of a socially-constructed Group.
These words relate to the relative ordering of two events or times.
A Subpart of a Time_period is picked out.
An Event is identified as occurring at a particular Distance and in a particular Direction from a Landmark_event.
In a text, a Source_of_information is given that provides a reader of the text with further Information relevant to the text.
frameExamples: Seven new members and the three countries <t>joined</t> the alliance five years ago.
<t>After</t> she arrived , she laid out her papers on the desk.
I nearly kicked my TV this afternoon after watching the shambolic <t><fex name='subpar'>end</fex></t> of the Austrian Grand-Prix .
Tell me that a week <t>from</t> now.
In Densmore's days it was sometimes made of an old-fashioned man's celluloid collar (<t>cf.</t> Densmore 1943: 116).
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location. The figure can be an entity or an event.
The <fen>Figures</fen> are items which mutually serve to identify the location of the other items.
The region within which a <fen>Figure</fen> might be found.  This role is exclusive of <fen>Figure</fen>, and is a reconstrual that is not possible with verb lexical units.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
The <fen>New_member</fen> becomes a member of a (socially-defined) <fen>Group</fen>.
The <fen>Group</fen> is a socially-constructed entity composed of members.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>New_member</fen> joins the <fen>Group</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the joining occurs.

The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is the event which is  being located in time with respect to some other event: The <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is profiled, in contrast to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>, which is backgrounded.
The <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen> is the event  with respect to which the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> is located.
The <fen>Focal_participant</fen> is the participant in the <fen>Focal_occasion</fen> which is profiled as being in a relation of relative time to the <fen>Landmark_occasion</fen>.
The part of the <fen>Time_period</fen> which is profiled.
A temporal span conceived of as a whole.
This role indicates the <fen>Time</fen> that is being referred to.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the reference point in which the Event  is anchored.
This role marks expressions that indicate the amount of time that lies between the Target and the <fen>Landmark_event</fen>.
This role marks expressions that indicate whether the Target is prior or subsequent to the <fen>Landmark_event</fen> on the time line.
This role indicates the <fen>Event</fen> temporally located with respect to the <fen>Landmark_event</fen>.
The <fen>Source_of_information</fen> is referred to as a source of information related to the current text.
listRoleExamples: <fex><t>Next to</t> the kitchen</fex> is the best place to locate your garage .
Have <fex>you</fex> signed up for the new Medicare Prescription program?
An avid skier myself, I ventured to Aspen and enrolled in Nevin's school <fex>last winter</fex> to see what all the fuss was about.
<fex>Hours of eating and drinking</fex> followed the wedding ceremony.
Hours of eating and drinking followed <fex>the wedding ceremony</fex>.
The findings mark the <fex>beginning</fex> of a new age of planetary science, in which 'extrasolar' planets can be directly measured and compared.
A zillion copies and clones have been made of this Russian game since it first was released in the mid <fex>80's</fex>.
Sue is going to pick me up again two days from <fex>tomorrow</fex>.
Peter will meet me <fex>a week</fex> from today
Mom last called me a week <fex><t>ago</t></fex>.
The accreting matter forms a disc whose instabilities trigger outbursts (see <fex>Lasota 2001</fex> for a review of the instability model).

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Schauer, J., McComb, J., Peters, J., Tobriner, J.
La Hue v. Coca- Cola Bottling, Inc.
Greenman v. Yuba Power Products, Inc.
Klein v. Duchess Sandwich Co., Ltd.
James, Product Liability, 34 Texas L. Rev. 44
Klein v. Duchess Sandwich Co., Ltd.
State Farm Mut. Auto Ins. Co.
B. F. Goodrich Co. v. Hammond
Prosser, Strict Liability to the Consumer, 69 Yale L.J. 1099
